chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: How many types of reproduction are there? What kind of reproduction do humans do? Asexual or sexual? You're not just one parent. You must have two parents, right? Which reproduction is better? Sexual reproduction or asexual reproduction? The kids are writing that sexual reproduction is better for them. You can't even do asexual reproduction. You're a human.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: How many types of reproduction are there? Only two types Asexual and Sexual Is there any Asexual Reproduction? I thought there is only sexual reproduction. No, there is Asexual Reproduction and Sexual Reproduction.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Very important, the difference between them The deep relationship between them The deep difference between them This is very important, listen carefully Listen first of all, what is Asexual Reproduction? Asexual Reproduction is the type of reproduction In which only one parent is involved Reproduction happens with only one parent

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: What kind of reproduction do humans do? Asexual or sexual? You are not just one parent. You must have two parents. Meaning? Meaning? In sexual reproduction, two parents are needed. In asexual reproduction, one parent is needed. It's obvious. So, if we talk about humans, they do sexual reproduction. Even plants are mainly sexual reproduction.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Yes, mainly they don't do sexual reproduction. Okay, next. Now see, there's a term called gametes. Gametes means sex cells. Meaning those cells which are useful in reproduction. We call them sex cells. Like in humans, there's a male sex cell called sperm. You must have heard of it. It's called sperm cell.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: You must have heard the name, I guess. You must have heard the name, ovum in a female. So basically, this is asexual reproduction. There are no sex cells in this. There is only one parent. Reproduction is happening from the same parent. So what is the need for sex cells? But here, gametes, i.e. sex cells are produced. Next thing.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Offspring and next generation are genetically identical to the parent. Meaning, the next generation is identical to the parent. Whereas, sexual reproduction has a lot of variations. Now you will ask, why?

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Think about it, there are two parents here, so I told you in the beginning that the DNA of two parents will combine with each other. So the more dominant DNA will show the characters. Do you understand? That is, because there are two parents here, there is a mixing of two DNAs. That's why there is more variation here.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Next point, Salivary divisions are only mitotic. It means that there is a mitotic division here. You can also say mitosis. And here there is a meiosis. Gametes are produced by meiotic division i.e. meiosis. Remember this much.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Mitosis, meiosis, if you have heard this term in 9th grade, if you haven't, just remember this term, mitosis, meiosis. Okay? Very good. One last point, large number of plants, not organisms. In asexual reproduction, a lot of organisms are produced in a very short time. Whereas in sexual reproduction, it takes a lot of time. Even in humans.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: It takes a lot of time to give birth to a new baby. It takes around 9-10 months to give birth to a baby. Overall time. Right? So that means asexual reproduction is very fast or slow. Okay. Are these differences clear? Are these differences clear? Now I have a question. Which one is better? Which one is better?

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Tell me, which reproduction is better, sexual reproduction or asexual reproduction? Kids are writing that sexual reproduction is better for them. You can't even do asexual reproduction, you are a human. You are not an organism. You are not an amoeba mumoea. Yeah. It will happen automatically. Sexual reproduction is better. Why?

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Because there are two parents here. So what will happen here? What will happen here? Variation. Do you understand? What will happen here? Variation. And when there is variation, Whenever there is variation, Remember, what happens because of variation? What happens because of variation? Variation is important.

chunks.title: Sexual vs Asexual Reproduction!   Class 10 Science   How Organisms Reproduce
chunks.text: Variation leads to evolution. Species can survive longer. This is why sexual reproduction is better. Because here, there is variation. And species can adapt faster due to variation.
